Policies and Initiatives.title: Before the first missiles fly: AI, cyber & electronic warfare - how India is preparing for invisible battlefields
Policies and Initiatives.summary: India is integrating AI, cyber, and electronic warfare into its military, shifting towards a process-centric doctrine. This integration, as seen in Operation Sindoor, aims to enhance intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance capabilities. The goal is to achieve strategic dominance and reduce reliance on foreign technology in future conflicts.

Policies and Initiatives.title: Before the first missiles fly: AI, cyber & electronic warfare - how India is preparing for invisible battlefields
Policies and Initiatives.summary: India is integrating AI, cyber, and electronic warfare into its military, adopting a process-centric doctrine over a platform-centric one. This shift, as seen in Operation Sindoor, aims to enhance intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance capabilities. The goal is to achieve strategic dominance and reduce reliance on foreign technology in future conflicts.

Policies and Initiatives.title: Mumbai to Host World’s First AI GCC Hub as Maharashtra & Supervity AI Sign Landmark MoU at Davos
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Mumbai will host the world's first AI GCC Hub after Maharashtra and Supervity AI signed a landmark MoU at Davos. The state will support talent enablement, including training up to 25,000 AI engineers over time. This initiative aims to establish Mumbai as a major AI hub, driven by the partnership between Maharashtra and Supervity AI.

Policies and Initiatives.title: Maharashtra poised to lead India’s public-sector AI adoption: Wadhwani AI
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Maharashtra is expected to take the lead in public-sector AI adoption in India, according to Wadhwani AI. The state's efforts to integrate AI into its public sector are anticipated to set an example for other regions. Wadhwani AI's statement highlights Maharashtra's potential to drive AI adoption in India's public sector.

Policies and Initiatives.title: Nagpur airport may get AI facial recognition to identify criminals
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Nagpur airport is considering the implementation of AI facial recognition technology to identify and detect criminals. The technology aims to enhance security measures at the airport by using artificial intelligence to recognize and match faces with existing databases. This move is part of efforts to improve safety and security at the airport.

Events.title: Jio to launch people-first Al platform - Here's what Reliance's Chairman Mukesh Ambani said
Events.summary: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani announced Jio's India-built AI platform at the Vibrant Gujarat conference. The platform aims to provide citizens access to AI in local languages, enhancing daily efficiency and productivity. This people-first AI platform is designed to make AI more accessible to the general public.

Major AI Developments.title: Persistent Extends Growth Run to 23 Quarters, Profit Slips 7% QoQ
Major AI Developments.summary: Persistent has extended its growth run to 23 quarters, with order bookings reaching $674.5 million in total contract value and $501.9 million in annual contract value. Despite this growth, the company's profit slipped 7% quarter-over-quarter. The company's consistent growth streak is a notable achievement in the industry.

Major AI Developments.title: Raana Semiconductors Raises $3 Mn Seed Funding for Silicon Ingot Systems
Major AI Developments.summary: Raana Semiconductors has raised $3 million in seed funding to develop silicon ingot systems. The company aims to reduce reliance on imported silicon ingots and wafers by enabling local manufacturing. This investment will support Raana Semiconductors' efforts to establish a domestic silicon production capability.

Major AI Developments.title: FireAI raises early-stage funding from IPV, VCats, and SucSEED Indovation
Major AI Developments.summary: FireAI, an AI analytics platform, has raised Rs 6.2 crore ($800K) in pre-seed and seed funding from investors including Inflection Point Ventures, Venture Catalyst, and SucSEED Indovation Fund. The startup has also launched a mobile decision intelligence app, with plans to use the funding to enhance its capabilities and scale infrastructure. The investment will further support the company's expansion and acceleration of enterprise adoption.

AI Start-Up News.title: Maharashtra poised to lead India’s public-sector AI adoption: Wadhwani AI
AI Start-Up News.summary: Maharashtra is expected to take the lead in India's public-sector adoption of artificial intelligence, according to Wadhwani AI. The state is poised to leverage AI for various public services and governance. Wadhwani AI anticipates Maharashtra to set an example for other states to follow in AI adoption.

AI Start-Up News.title: How this deeptech startup is driving seaweed cultivation along the western coast of India
AI Start-Up News.summary: ClimaCrew, a Mumbai-based deeptech startup, is promoting seaweed cultivation along India's western coast by partnering with coastal communities and industries. The company uses an AI-driven platform to analyze satellite data and identify suitable locations for seaweed cultivation. This initiative aims to harness the nutritional potential of seaweed in Gujarat and Maharashtra.

AI Start-Up News.title: Digital clinic Pinky Promise raises $1 Mn led by Rebalance Angel Community
AI Start-Up News.summary: Pinky Promise, an AI-led digital clinic for women, has raised $1 million in a pre-seed funding round led by Rebalance Angel Community. The funding will be used to accelerate integrated offerings, support physical clinics, and expand nutritional supplements. The company, co-founded in 2020 by Divya Kamerkar and Akanksha Vyas, aims to enable continuity of care at a national scale.
